entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary: The discussion centers around the concept of allowing addresses to provide proof of life and possession through signature verification as a means to continue operation without participating in an update scheme. The feasibility of this approach is questioned, with skepticism cast on the motivation to develop such functionality. The practice of ceasing support for vulnerable software and systems is highlighted as common across various platforms. Examples include Bitcoin Core, which offers support for 18 months, Ubuntu's long-term support spanning 5 years, and Windows' provision of unpaid support also for a duration of 5 years. For more details on the support timelines for various systems and software, a reference is made to [endoflife.date](https://endoflife.date/), suggesting that the discontinuation of support for outdated or vulnerable technology is a standard procedure within the tech industry. This conversation is part of the broader discussions within the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, indicating its relevance to cryptocurrency development practices.
